page.title: 20Golf in Leven.
page.content: The Municipal is Levens public golf course and it can be played on by paying at the clubhouse.There are mine workings near the middle of the course that can be seen near the 3rd hole. Before the war the Municipal was a 9-hole ladies course but was ploughed up during the war to make room for more crops.After the war it was rebuilt into an 18-hole course. The Thistle and Innerleven golf clubs share the course which is near the sea shore.The Innerleven golf club once had their own course at Dubbieside but this was displaced when the Methil docks were built.They then moved to Leven and shared a course with Leven Thistle.The Municipal is 4967 metres long and the Thistle and Innerleven course is 5881 metres.
